Welcome to Team Project’s documentation!¶

Flask Application¶

The backend Flask app for the Resturant Management System.

This handles all of the routing and calling of downstream services to indivudally handle requests. There is no logic in this file.

Authentication Class¶

The main authentication class used for API token validation, logging in and auth token exchanges.

Important to note that there aren’t inherent security features built into this class as it is designed to be called by API handlers. Python also doesn’t have private methods so there isn’t much point designing code to prevent access tokens being generate out of sequence as the method can be called anyway

class frameworks.authentication.auth.authentication(token, secret)¶

The constructor for the authentication class.

A valid API key and secret (here named token instead of key) need to be provided. These are used to authenticate API requests from a client.

authenticateRequest(access_tok, uid, level)¶

Takes provided API creds and ensures the user has been previously authenticated.

Parameters:
  • access_tok – should have been previously issued at a valid login
  • uid – the user ID we are expecting to log in
  • level – the permissions level of the resource (int)
Returns:

int with HTTP status code

401 - authentication not completed/expired

403 - not permitted for given level

404 - something is not correct (couldn’t find the user)

authenticateUser(username, password)¶

User authentication for waiter, kitchen staff or manager.

Parameters:
  • username – Valid username
  • password – Valid password
Returns:

False on error or userID on success.
generateAccessToken(uid)¶

Generates an access token that can be used to authenticate API requests. Needs to be provided to authenticateRequest

Parameters:uid – a valid user ID
Returns:Access token

Customer Class¶

class frameworks.customer.customer.customer¶

Object representation of a customer.

Provides various helper methods. Exclusivly used in order class.

createCustomer(name, email)¶

Allows creation of a new customer.

Parameters:
  • name – Customer’s name
  • email – Customer’ email
Returns:

Customer’s ID
getCustomer(customerID)¶

Gets customer data.

Parameters:customerID – Customer’s ID
Returns:dict of customer data
locateCustomer(email)¶

Checks whether a customer already exists for supplied parameters.

Parameters:email – Email to check for existing customer’s with.
Returns:Customer ID for existing customer
Returns:False if no customer found
Raises:Error on duplicate customers

Database Class¶

class frameworks.database.db.db¶

Encapsulation of database connection.

Creates a new connection upon instantiation and closes the connection upon destruction. Whilst you’re unlikely to need to access the class more than once you need to keep it in scope otherwise it will be auto-destructed by Python.

Example useage:

self.__databaseClass = db()
self.__connectionObject = databaseClass.getInstance()
getInstance()¶

Getter for connection instance.

Returns:PyMySQL connection object

ID Class¶

class frameworks.idGenerator.id.id¶

Wrapper for cuid.

getID(prefix)¶

Wrapper for cuid with custom prefix.

Parameters:prefix – Prefix to append CUID ID with
Returns:unique ID string

Item Class¶

class frameworks.item.item.item¶

Object representation of an Item with various helper methods.

get()¶

Getter for loaded data.

Returns:dict with item data or null if it hasn’t been loaded.load
load(id)¶

Given an ID, loads the relevant data from the database into the object.

Parameters:id – valid item ID
save()¶

NOP. Hasn’t been implemented yet.

Items Class¶

class frameworks.items.items.items¶

Items class which uses item class. Includes various helper methods.

get()¶

Getter for the loaded items.

Returns:List of Item objects.
load()¶

Load all items.

loadDisabled()¶

Load disabled items.

loadEnabled()¶

Load enabled items.

setItemsToggle(items)¶

Sets the toggle for supplied item and toggle pairs.

Parameters:items – dict of itemID and enabled pairs, where enabled is True or False depending.
updateItem(itemID, fields)¶

Updates an item with the supplied fields.

Parameters:
  • itemID – the item ID to update
  • fields – dict of fields with attributes for the item and value pairs.

Notifications Class¶

class frameworks.notifications.notifications.notifications¶

Notifications class to support sending arbitory notifications to and from the customer and resturant staff.

createNotification(table, type, meta)¶

Creates a notification for a customer to the waiter.

Parameters:
  • table – table number that has created the notification
  • type – type of notification that has been made
  • meta – metadata JSON
Returns:

notification ID
getNotification(id)¶

Get’s the notifiation data.

Parameters:id – valid notification ID
Returns:dict of notification data
getUnreadByTable(table)¶

Get’s unread notifications by the table that created them.

Also marks all of these notifications read.

Parameters:table – table number to filter by
Returns:dict of notification data

Order Class¶

class frameworks.order.order.order¶

Order class to handle the representation of an order. Includes various helper methods.

createOrder(name, email, table, items)¶

Create an order for a customer.

Parameters:
  • name – customer’s name
  • email – customer’s email
  • table – customer’s table
  • items – dict of items the customer has selected
Returns:

order ID on success
getCustomer()¶

Getter for customer associated with loaded order

Returns:Loaded order status information
getOrderHistory()¶

Getter for private order history field

Returns:Loaded order history information
getOrderInfo()¶

Getter for private order information field.

Returns:Loaded order information
getOrderStatus()¶

Getter for private order status field

Returns:Loaded order status information
kitchenComplete(id)¶

Marks an item as completed by the kitchen

Parameters:id – order ID to mark
kitchenConfirm(id, eta=0)¶

Marks an item as confirmed by the kitchen

Parameters:
  • id – order ID to mark as confirmed
  • eta – optional parameter for the expected time taken to complete the order
loadOrderHistory(orderID)¶

Loads order history into class.

Parameters:orderID – order ID to load history for
Returns:True on success
Raises:order not found exception
loadOrderInfo(orderID)¶

Loads order information into class.

Parameters:orderID – order ID to load order information for
Returns:true on success
Raises:exception on order ID not found
orderCancel(id, refund='')¶

Marks an item as cancelled.

Parameters:
  • id – order ID to mark as canclled
  • refund – Stripe refund ID, if the order was in a stage that required issuing a refund
paymentComplete(id, chargeID)¶

Marks a payment as complete.

Parameters:
  • id – order ID to mark as paid
  • chargeID – the associated Stripe Charge ID
waiterComplete(id)¶

Marks an item as completed by the waiter

Parameters:id – order ID to mark
waiterConfirm(id)¶

Marks an item as confirmed by the waiter

Parameters:id – order ID to mark

Orders Class¶

class frameworks.order.orders.orders¶

Class for orders with helper methods. This does not extend orders as none of the methods are shared.

getOrders()¶

Getter for loaded orders

Returns:dict of loaded orders
loadOrders(filter)¶

Loads orders according the filter provided and mappings stored by the class.

Parameters:filter – filter (endpoint name)
Returns:True on success
Raises:exception if mapping does not exist

Payment Class¶

class frameworks.payment.payment.payment¶

Class to handle payment interactions with Stripe on the backend.

cancelCharge(orderID)¶

Cancels authorised or presented charges on an order ID.

Parameters:orderID – order ID to cancel charges for
Returns:True on success
Returns:False on failure
submitAuthorisation(orderID, tokenID)¶

Submits an authorisation to Stripe based on tokenised information from form.

Parameters:
  • orderID – order ID for which the payment is being submitted
  • tokenID – Stripe token from the frontend payment form
Returns:

Dict with success or failure message
submitPresentment(orderID)¶

Submits a presentment for an order with Stripe charge ID :param orderID: order ID to submit the presentment for :returns: True on success :raises: exception for order that is not authorised or has already presented :raises: exception when presentment failed
